common_issues.title: Pieces OS Login and Account Linking Issues
common_issues.description: Users reported problems with login and account linking across Windows and Linux, including infinite loading screens and 500 errors. Issues often arose after updates and involved Google and GitHub integration.  Solutions included new authentication systems, account merging, and bug fixes by Pieces.  Providing logs and OS details aided troubleshooting.

related_issues.title: Pieces Desktop app, account linking never acheived for several years?
related_issues.text:
Pieces Desktop app, account linking never acheived for several years?
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.0.4

### Early Access Program

- [x] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

I have been experiencing an issue with the Pieces Desktop app where I am unable to link both my Google and GitHub accounts simultaneously. Despite following the documentation and contacting support multiple times, over several years, the issue persists?

Steps to Reproduce:

Log in to the Pieces Desktop app using my Google account.
Go to Settings > Account & Cloud Integrations.
Click on the GitHub integration and authenticate via GitHub.
After authentication, I am redirected back to the app, and only the GitHub account is linked.
Attempt to add the Google account again, authenticate, and return to the app.
Only the Google account is now linked, and the GitHub account is unlinked.
Expected Behavior: Both Google and GitHub accounts should be linked simultaneously.

Actual Behavior: Only one account (either Google or GitHub) is linked at a time. The other account gets unlinked when attempting to add both.

Additional Information:

I have been using the same email address for both Google and GitHub accounts since day one.
I have contacted support in the past, and they have reset data on their end, but the issue persists.
Disabling the GitHub email privacy option did not resolve the issue.
Environment:

Additional Context: I would prefer to resolve this issue over GitHub or Discord rather than booking a call, as past contact attempts via calls have not resolved the issue.  Also its not a critical requirement for me to use the app but it would be nice to one day be able to actually use this very old feature.
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation:

**Key points raised:**

* Johnkennyuk was experiencing issues linking his Github and Google accounts.
* Mark-at-pieces, a support representative, identified the problem as two separate accounts registered with different email capitalization.
* A workaround was attempted by merging the accounts, but the capitalization issue persisted.

**Solutions proposed/implemented:**

* Mark-at-pieces suggested waiting for a new authentication system to be implemented (estimated timeframe: early/mid March).
* Johnkennyuk successfully linked his accounts using the new authentication system but in the wrong order.
* Mark-at-pieces offered to schedule a call to resolve the issue.

**Current status/outcome:**

* The issue is temporarily resolved with the new authentication system.
* Johnkennyuk needs to re-link his accounts in the correct order.
* Mark-at-pieces is available to assist with this process.

**Additional points:**

* Johnkennyuk is a senior IT engineer and confident in resolving the issue himself.
* Mark-at-pieces acknowledged the capitalization issue as a known problem with the old authentication system.

**Outcome:**

The issue is resolved with the new authentication system, but a minor correction is needed. Mark-at-pieces is available to assist with this final step.

### Checked for Existing Issues?

### Software

Desktop Application, Pieces OS

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.3.0

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

After updating pieces to latest version, I was loggged out (This was part of the update, which I saw in the update / release notes.). But when I try to log in, always end up at https://authentication.pieces.services/ without moving forward. that page keep loading and nothing happens.
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation

**Key Points Raised:**
* Users are experiencing an infinite loading screen when trying to link their Google account after updating to Pieces OS 11.3.0.
* The issue occurs when trying to login through both the Pieces Desktop app and the PiecesOS toolbar.
* The issue affects users on Windows 11.

**Problems Identified:**
* The infinite loading screen prevents users from linking their Google account.
* The issue appears to be related to a new authentication flow introduced in the latest update.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**
* The Pieces team identified the issue and implemented a fix.
* Users are advised to try logging in again.

**Current Status/Outcome:**
* The authentication issue has been resolved.
* Users are able to successfully link their Google accounts.

**Additional Notes:**
* The Pieces team requested additional information from affected users, including screen recordings and support logs.
* The issue appears to be specific to Windows 11 users.
* The team has closed the issue, but users are encouraged to reopen it if they continue to experience problems.

## Additional Important Details:

* The issue appears to be intermittent, as some users are able to connect their accounts while others are not.
* The issue may be related to specific browser configurations or network settings.
* The Pieces team is continuing to investigate the issue to ensure it is fully resolved.

## Overall, the conversation highlights the importance of clear communication and collaboration between users and developers to identify and resolve technical issues.

common_issues.title: Pieces OS and Desktop App Installation and Login Issues
common_issues.description: Users are experiencing installation and login issues across Windows and Linux. Problems include invalid port errors during Windows installation, database corruption preventing Pieces OS from starting, and HTTP 500 errors during login on Linux. Solutions involve running Windows installers with admin privileges, updating to the latest Pieces OS version, and providing detailed logs to support for further analysis.

related_issues.text:
Invalid Port (at character 18) http://127.0.0.1:null/connect
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

Latest from 17032025 (can't find it)

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

Hi I am stuck at the initial stages. Where the desktop app is being initialized. I am at verify dependency connections and it says unable to open pieces core services. "FormatException: Invalid Port (at character 18) http://127.0.0.1:null/connect.

It might be an antivirus stopping it. I am not sure. But I have restarted and reinstalled to no effect.
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation

**Key Points Raised:**
* SherlockSol is experiencing the "Invalid Port (at character 18) http://127.0.0.1:null/connect error" with Pieces Desktop on Windows.
* uzaxirr is also experiencing the same issue.
* zedevmed was able to fix the issue by installing PiecesOS and Pieces Desktop using WinGet in an elevated PowerShell session.

**Identified Problems:**
* Pieces Desktop installation without admin privileges doesn't bind to a local port correctly, leading to the error.

**Proposed/Implemented Solutions:**
* zedevmed suggests promoting the MSIX or winget installation method on the docs.
* Pieces team requests more information from affected users to reproduce and fix the issue.

**Current Status/Outcome:**
* The Pieces team is investigating the issue and has reached out to affected users for troubleshooting.
* The status of the issue is not currently resolved.

**Most Important Details:**
* The "Invalid Port" error is caused by the Pieces Desktop installation not having admin privileges.
* Running the installation with admin privileges can resolve the issue.
* The Pieces team is actively investigating the issue and working on a solution.

* Antoine79 is experiencing issues with their database in Pieces OS.
* The issue seems to be related to database corruption and AVX2 support.
* Mark-at-Pieces has identified the core issue and is pushing a fix to 11.3.2.

### Problems Identified

* Database corruption due to faulty install process.
* Missing AVX2 support on Intel i7-2600 CPU.

* Issue is resolved.

* Mark-at-Pieces is thankful for Antoine79's patience and contribution to the troubleshooting process.

common_issues.title: Pieces OS Crash/Startup Failure Due to Database Corruption
common_issues.description: Multiple users reported Pieces OS crashing or failing to start on macOS and Windows due to database corruption after updating to version 11.0.0 or later.  Error messages include "Unexpected error occurred" and "LateInitializationError: Field 'database' has not been initialized."  A fix was implemented in version 11.3.2. Users experiencing this issue should update to the latest version.  Manual folder creation might be needed in some cases.

## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation

### Key Points

* Antoine79 is experiencing issues with their database in Pieces OS.
* The issue seems to be related to database corruption and AVX2 support.
* Mark-at-Pieces has identified the core issue and is pushing a fix to 11.3.2.

### Problems Identified

* Database corruption due to faulty install process.
* Missing AVX2 support on Intel i7-2600 CPU.

### Solutions Proposed/Implemented

* Created the missing folder `com.pieces.os\production\Pieces\couchbase.cblite2` manually.
* Identified the requirement for AVX2 support and worked on a fix for CPUs without it.

### Current Status/Outcome

* Fix is implemented in version 11.3.2, which is now live.
* Issue is resolved.

### Additional Notes

* Antoine79 will need to update to version 11.3.2 to benefit from the fix.
* Mark-at-Pieces is thankful for Antoine79's patience and contribution to the troubleshooting process.

macOS

Early Access Program

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

Pieces OS fails to start because it is unable to open the database due to corruption. The error message displayed is: LateInitializationError: Field 'database' has not been initialized.

Steps to Reproduce:

Attempt to start Pieces OS on macOS.
Observe the error message indicating database corruption.
Expected Behavior: I expected Pieces OS to start normally and access the database without any issues.
